actions.args: {"id": 99, "body": {"name": "Travel Stipend [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "Hi, I\\\\\\'m Ahnaf, a full-stack developer with >4 years of experience. I have been in the NEAR ecosystem since 2020. I was one of the early engineers at Paras. Since then, I have been involved in various projects across the NEAR ecosystem, such as the NEAR wallet selector, NFT standards, Paras token, Paras NFT marketplace, and many more. I also have hands-on experience with NEAR\\\\\\'s latest technologies such as zero balance account, signed delegate, chain abstraction, and NEAR AI initiatives.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "kyc_verified": false, "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "Over the past year, I have been actively contributing to the NEAR ecosystem through various projects. Notably, I participated in metabuild Hackathon, where my team and I received [honorable mention](https://devpost.com/software/geovox) for our project. This recognition has further motivated me to continue contributing within the ecosystem. In addition, I also joined various hackathons in other blockchain projects, which deepened my knowledge of other blockchain technologies as well.\\\\n\\\\nFor this year\\\\u{2019}s Hackathon, my team and I are developing an AI tool designed to assist developers working within the NEAR ecosystem. We believe this tool will greatly enhance the developer experience by automating and optimizing common workflows.\\\\n\\\\nAttending this Hackathon will not only allow me to present our AI tool but also to further collaborate and contribute to the ecosystem. I am confident that the support provided will make a meaningful impact on my ability to participate and represent our community.\\\\n\\\\n**Travel cost**\\\\nI am writing to request a travel stipend to support my participation in the upcoming Redacted event in Thailand this November. The stipend will primarily cover my flight, accommodation, and expenses during the trip. Below are the detail of the costs:\\\\n- Flight (Jakarta to Bangkok and Bangkok to Jakarta) ~$200\\\\n- Hotel for 3 nights ~$200\\\\n- Other travel expense (meal, ticket, local transport, etc) ~$100\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Links**\\\\nHere is the link to my link portfolio showcasing my contributions and top projects:\\\\nGithub: https://github.com/ahnafalfariza/\\\\nDevpost: https://devpost.com/ahnafalfariza\\\\n\\\\nSome of my top projects within the ecosystem include\\\\n1. Geovox (geovox.xyz)\\\\n2. Paras product (one of early dApps on NEAR)\\\\n3. NEAR dev tools\\\\n4. NEAR decentralized component", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "ahnaf.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"id": 102, "body": {"name": "NearStack team expenses for REDICTED HACKATHON Bangkok Nov 9 - 11", "summary": "Hi, I\\\\u{2019}m @pichtran.near . I\\\\u{2019}m seeking support for travel expenses, including airfare and accommodation, for my stay in Bangkok from November 8 to April 11. Any assistance or recommendations for affordable lodging options would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "### **Introduction:**\\\\nNearstack focuses on simplifying frontend development for Web3 by utilizing NEAR BOS components, enhanced by AI-generated code suggestions. We have created a platform that allows developers to visualize component relationships through a React flow interface. This approach makes it easier to understand how different components interact, improving developer efficiency and contributing to the growing NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n### **Purpose:**\\\\nWe are passionate about advancing our project and making a meaningful contribution to the NEAR ecosystem. We see a lot of potential in our platform to create real-world value by streamlining development processes with AI and BOS components. The Bangkok hackathon offers an incredible opportunity for us to take this project further, engage with like-minded developers, and learn from the NEAR community. Attending the event will help us refine our vision and push the boundaries of what\\\\\\'s possible with our project.\\\\n\\\\n### **Request for Travel Stipend:**\\\\nWe are seeking assistance with flights to Bangkok, which cost approximately $350 per person. We would also greatly appreciate staying at a NEAR Hackerhouse if available. If not, we request up to $200 per person for accommodation. We are not requesting any additional funds for food or miscellaneous expenses, as we plan to cover those ourselves.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam\\\\n\\\\n### **Estimated breakdown:**\\\\n\\\\n- Flight cost per person: $350\\\\n- Accommodation cost per person: $200\\\\n- Team size: 4 students\\\\n- Request per student: $500 (Capping according to T&C)\\\\n- Total: $2000 (We can pay $1500 for ourselves)\\\\n- Total request: $500\\\\n\\\\n### **About Our Project: Frontend Flow with NEAR BOS and AI**\\\\nOur project integrates NEAR BOS components with AI-driven code suggestions to simplify the frontend development process. We provide a visual React flow interface, allowing developers to see how components interact. This approach enhances the efficiency and clarity of development workflows, particularly within decentralized applications. By contributing to the NEAR ecosystem, we aim to make Web3 development more accessible to all.\\\\nExplore ours project apply to REDACTED Bangkok: https://www.nearstack.weminal.com/\\\\n\\\\n### **Past Project:**\\\\nWedata - 3RD Native track at Web3Hackfest: https://devfolio.co/projects/wedata-3418\\\\nFastUI - Fast component UI on BOS at BOS hacks: https://near.social/fastui.near/widget/FastUI\\\\nBOS wallet - BOS wallet on NearSocial at BOS hacks: https://near.social/pichtran.near/widget/BOSwallet\\\\n\\\\n### **About my team:**\\\\nPhuc Tinh: AI engineer; First author of a paper at PACLIC 37 Conference (2023) - Rank C; Co-author of a paper in Neural Computing and Applications journal (Q1, accepted 2024).\\\\nQuiVo: Blockchain Developer; 3RD Native track at Web3Hackfest with Wedata.\\\\nTung Le: Technical Lead.\\\\nLoc Hoang: Fullstack Developer.\\\\nPich Tran: Blockchain Developer.\\\\n\\\\nWhy We Need the Support\\\\nAs students, we are managing most expenses on our own, but the flight costs present a challenge. This travel stipend would enable us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on building our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem, rather than worrying about travel logistics.\\\\n\\\\n### **Conclusion:**\\\\nWe are excited about the opportunity to participate in the Bangkok hackathon and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would help us cover the necessary travel costs and allow us to concentrate on our project. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\n\\\\n@pichtran.near\\\\n\\\\nTeam Nearstack", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "fastui.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Bounty", "Hackathon", "Travel expenses"]}

{"id": 105, "body": {"name": "Travel Stipend [Redacted] [Team GBH]", "summary": "As a developer and builder, I have had the privilege of participating in and winning two of your previous hackathons. These experiences have allowed me to contribute to public goods funding projects that align with your organization\\\\\\'s goals. Please help us get to Redacted. ", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "I am Bigtide and I represent team GBH. I have participated and won in 2 past near hackathons (EthSeoul2024 / NEAR HZN). These experiences have allowed me to contribute to public goods funding projects that align with NEAR foundation\\\\\\'s goals. Furthermore, I am associated with Ludium, a successful collaborator of NEAR, as I know.  \\\\nMe and my other team member (Chanho) want to participate in Redacted IRL. Given our shared commitment to building impactful solutions, I would greatly appreciate any support you can provide to help facilitate my participation. \\\\n\\\\n# Plan for Redacted\\\\nWe have previously deployed \\\\\\'Dead Project Snipper\\\\\\' project as part of AI-PGF initiative. Dead Project Snipper aggregates data points to access whether Grant Project is active or inactive. We are looking to update the frontend and other features to continue the development and present it in Redacted Hackathon. \\\\n\\\\n# Travel Plan / Cost\\\\nI will be deaprting from South Korea, heading to Bangkok. \\\\n\\\\nFlight: Average round trip from Korea(Incheon) to Bangkok is about $300 - $350 per person.\\\\nStay: The average stay is 30 - 50 $USD per night per person. For 3 nights that would be 90 - 150 $USD\\\\nFood: Average food cost is expected to be $15-20 per day per person. For 3 days that would be 45 - 60 $USD\\\\nTotal: All things considered, I would like to ask for 1000 $USDC in total, $500 per person. \\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "bigtide.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"]}

{"id": 113, "body": {"name": "Red Flight Team => Travel Stipend [Redacted] - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "Red Flight is an AI Red Teaming NFT Game developed on the NEAR Protocol. As a leading AI Security & Safety company, we\\\\\\'ve created a platform where users can conduct AI red teaming exercises, participate in bug bounties, and tokenize successful attack strategies as NFTs. We\\\\\\'re expanding our impact through strategic partnerships, having recently concluded discussions with Meta\\\\\\'s VP Boon regarding a collaborative red teaming event with Meta Korea, while also engaging with Erica Kang from NEAR.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "# Red Flight: AI Red Teaming NFT Gaming Platform\\\\n\\\\n## Overview\\\\nRed Flight is our innovative AI Red Teaming NFT Game built on the NEAR Protocol. We\\\\\\'ve created a unique platform where AI security testing meets blockchain gaming, allowing users to conduct red teaming exercises and monetize their findings through NFTs, all while contributing to global AI safety standards.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## AI Security Gaming Features\\\\nOur platform supports various security testing operations:\\\\n* AI Red Teaming\\\\n* Bug Bounty Programs\\\\n* Attack Data NFT Minting\\\\n* Security Strategy Trading through NFT trading\\\\n\\\\nMore Detail info : https://devpost.com/software/red-flight?ref_content=user-portfolio&ref_feature=in_progress\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend:\\\\nWe are seeking assistance with flights to Bangkok, which cost approximately $350 per person. We would also greatly appreciate staying at a NEAR Hackerhouse if available. And we request up to $200 per person for accommodation. \\\\n\\\\nDeparture: ICN, South Korea \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} ICN, South Korea\\\\n\\\\n## Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 2 \\\\nRequest per person: $500 \\\\nTotal: $1,000 \\\\nTotal request: $1,000\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Team\\\\nOur award-winning team brings expertise in:\\\\n* AI Security & Safety\\\\n* Blockchain Development\\\\n* Game Design\\\\nEvent Participants : \\\\nYoujun Lee : Software Developer / CPO\\\\nHaon Park : AI Hacker\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\nRed Flight represents a significant advancement in AI security testing, combining the rigor of professional security assessment with the accessibility of gaming. By leveraging blockchain technology and NFTs, we\\\\\\'re creating a sustainable ecosystem that incentivizes and rewards contributions to AI safety.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n*Best regards,*  \\\\n*Team Red Flight*\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [109, 108, 107], "receiver_account": "youjun.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Meetup", "Hackathon", "Travel expenses"]}

{"body": {"name": "BuildLink team expenses for [REDICTED] HACKATHON Bangkok Nov 9 - 11", "summary": "Build Links is an innovative AI-Blockchain project developed on the NEAR Protocol, aimed at bridging Web3 and Web2 by enabling users to interact with blockchain functionalities through an AI-powered chat interface. By simplifying access to on-chain actions, Build Links enhances the user experience for decentralized applications.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "## Overview:\\\\n[Buildlink](https://buildlink.vercel.app/)  is our innovative project designed to bring the power of blockchain into everyday communication. Built on the NEAR Protocol, Build Link uses AI to create seamless, interactive on-chain experiences within a chat interface, simplifying access to blockchain features for both seasoned Web3 users and newcomers.\\\\n\\\\n## Example:\\\\nBob: \\\\\\\"I want to transfer 2 NEAR to alice.near.\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\nThe AI will interpret this request and generate an interactive user interface (UI) directly within the chat. With a simple click, Bob can confirm the transaction, opening a wallet modal where he can securely sign and complete the transfer. This streamlined approach eliminates the need to navigate complex Web3 interfaces, making blockchain interactions as simple as chatting.\\\\n\\\\n## On-Chain Interactions in Chat\\\\nUsers can perform a variety of on-chain operations right from the chat interface. Build Links supports:\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Transfers \\\\u{2013} Instantly transfer NEAR tokens to other users.\\\\n- NFT Minting \\\\u{2013} Mint NFTs directly with a single command.\\\\n- Staking \\\\u{2013} Stake tokens within the chat for passive income.\\\\n- Other On-Chain Operations \\\\u{2013} Any interaction that can be executed on-chain, such as governance votes or smart contract calls\\\\n\\\\n.![https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreickdzryobxg37adrbv7ia4c7rz6hxvctea6pxlndldew6wknjzzd4](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreickdzryobxg37adrbv7ia4c7rz6hxvctea6pxlndldew6wknjzzd4)\\\\n\\\\n## AI-Powered UI Generation\\\\nThe AI generates the necessary UI for each request, reducing user input and enhancing accessibility. Users no longer need to switch between different platforms, as the chat AI handles and processes all requests in real-time.\\\\n\\\\n## Seamless Web3-to-Web2 Transition\\\\nBuild Links integrates Web3 functionalities into a familiar Web2 chat experience. This accessibility lowers the entry barrier, making blockchain features easy to use even for those new to Web3.\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend:\\\\nWe are seeking assistance with flights to Bangkok, which cost approximately $350 per person. We would also greatly appreciate staying at a NEAR Hackerhouse if available. If not, we request up to $200 per person for accommodation. We are not requesting any additional funds for food or miscellaneous expenses, as we plan to cover those ourselves.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam\\\\n\\\\n## Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 3 students\\\\nRequest per student: $500 (Capping according to T&C)\\\\nTotal: $1500 (We can pay $1000 for ourselves)\\\\nTotal request: $500\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Project: Frontend Flow and AI\\\\nAt Build Link, we\\\\u{2019}re passionate about making blockchain accessible and intuitive. Traditional Web3 interfaces can be complex, especially for users not familiar with decentralized technology. Our mission is to break down these barriers by creating a Web2-friendly interface where users can conduct complex blockchain operations as easily as sending a message.\\\\nExplore ours project apply to REDACTED Bangkok: https://buildlink.vercel.app/\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## About my team:\\\\nHuynh Anh: Blockchain Engineer.\\\\nAnh Tuan: Software Engineer.\\\\nVuong: FullStack Developer\\\\n\\\\nGithub : \\\\n- https://github.com/SaitamaCoderVN\\\\n- https://github.com/chauanhtuan185\\\\n- https://github.com/Lou1sVuong\\\\n\\\\n## Why We Need the Support?\\\\nAs students, we are managing most expenses on our own, but the flight costs present a challenge. This travel stipend would enable us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on building our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem, rather than worrying about travel logistics.\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion:\\\\nWe are excited about the opportunity to participate in the Bangkok hackathon and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would help us cover the necessary travel costs and allow us to concentrate on our project. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\n\\\\nTeam BuildLink\\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "3b9491e8ee7fd298fade8fe8b453db9604078de7b8534035ae1d35bb8baf58e5", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses", "Bounty"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 131479798}
